definition: a drop in the ocean (idiom)
blue-green or azure (of water)/vast (of water)/cold
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
grain/millet/goose bumps
surname Su

sentences.english: The strength of an individual， as compared with that of the masses， is but a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 個人的力量和羣衆的力量相比，不過是滄海一粟。

sentences.english: But against the vast expanse of the sky, the chute looked very small.
sentences.chinese: 但和廣闊無垠的天空相比，降落傘看起來是滄海一粟。

sentences.english: A fire-fighting helicopter approaches the blaze in Bunyip .
sentences.chinese: 滄海一粟消防直升機接近大火。

sentences.english: We know that in this respect we are part of a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道，在這一方面我們只不過是滄海一粟。

sentences.english: The universe is vast, space and time infinite, individual is only a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙浩渺，時空無限，個人只是滄海一粟。

sentences.english: But these villages are just a drop in the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 但這兩個村莊只是滄海一粟。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
as time goes by (idiom)

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
dazzling/brilliant
false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
changeable situation (idiom)
monstrous and multicolored/grotesque and variegated
born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
